page.title: 09FARM VISIT,POSBURY CONTD.
page.content: to make silage.To keep the grass dry and in the same condition as it was cut the farmers put a large plastic sheet over it all, with lots of old car tyres on top to keep the sheet in place. This also keeps out moisture and air. It is left then till the winter when it is fed to the cattle and sheep.Then we saw the pen the farmer puts the bullocks in before they mate.There is an escape route both sides so that a man can get out and the bull stays in.It is illegal not to have one.Once again we saw some more cows,one was called Charlie and he was really tame. When we got back to the Pope's farmhouse we got changed for swimming and went in the outdoor pool in the garden.It was lovely and warm although it was cloudy and then it began to spit with rain!
